author: wsjcom
title: What’s News: World-Wide
text:
0 COMMENTS The Treasury levied sanctions against more than three dozen Russian individuals and entities in what U.S. officials said is a response to Kremlin aggressions.
China vowed to retaliate forcefully if the U.S. imposed new tariffs on Chinese goods and ruled out talks while Washington is escalating trade pressure.
Kelly told Trump that EPA chief Pruitt needs to step down after a series of negative reports, a White House official said.
Protests turned deadly at the Israel-Gaza border as Palestinians burned tires and some tried to enter Israel under military gunfire.
South Korea’s Park was sentenced to 24 years in jail for the ex-leader’s role in a corruption scandal.
Brazil’s da Silva was negotiating his surrender with police to begin serving a 12-year prison term.
The administration is seeking to tighten rules governing immigrants caught crossing the Mexican border illegally.
Federal authorities seized Backpage, a website known for its sex ads.
